thread.title: Thailand backpackers murder trial could collapse
thread.title_full: Thailand backpackers murder trial could collapse

title: Thailand backpackers murder trial could collapse
text:
Thailand backpackers murder trial could collapse 13 July 2015 Save 
The Thai murder trial of the suspected killers of two British backpackers has been adjourned amid concerns it is close to collapse. 
The trial of two Burmese migrants Zaw Lin and Wai Phyo for the murders of Hannah Witheridge and David Miller on a beach in Kao Tao last September has been adjourned until July 22. 
The defendants’ lawyers are preparing to call for an acquittal when the case resumes thanks to “incredibly significant information from an independent authority”, said British migrant rights activist Andy Hall who is working with the team. 
He added: “We hope by the end of the prosecution case, we will have destroyed it and we will show that it is completely lacking in credibility.” 
Hall has refused to specify what the information is, but it is believed to relate to DNA samples taken from one of the victims’ bodies upon their return to the UK.
